title: Intelligent Game Playing Agent
description:
Build an AI agent that plays a complex game using adversarial search techniques.

## Objectives
- Implement minimax with alpha-beta pruning
- Design effective evaluation functions
- Optimize search depth and move ordering
- Compare with MCTS implementation
- Analyze performance and play quality

## Deliverables
- Complete game implementation with GUI
- Multiple AI agents with different strategies
- Performance analysis and comparison
- Tournament results and statistics
- Technical report on design decisions
requirements: Choose a game: Chess, Go (9x9), Othello, or Connect Four
Implement game rules and state representation
Create AI vs AI tournament system
Analyze time complexity and branching factor

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Complete game implementation with robust state representation, all rules correctly implemented, and polished GUI

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Functional game implementation with correct rules and basic GUI, minor issues present

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic game implementation with most rules working, GUI may be incomplete

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Incomplete game implementation with significant rule errors or missing components

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Correct minimax with alpha-beta pruning, optimal move ordering, excellent performance optimization

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Correct minimax with alpha-beta pruning, basic move ordering implemented

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Minimax implemented, alpha-beta pruning present but may have inefficiencies

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimax incomplete or incorrect, pruning missing or broken

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated domain-specific evaluation function with multiple strategic features, produces strong play

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Effective evaluation function with relevant features, produces competent play

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic evaluation function that works but lacks strategic depth

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Naive or incorrect evaluation function, poor game play quality

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive analysis including complexity analysis, tournament results, strategy comparisons, and detailed insights

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good analysis with tournament results and performance metrics, covers main aspects

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic performance analysis present, some metrics or comparisons missing

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal or superficial analysis, lacking key performance metrics

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Clean, well-organized code with comprehensive documentation and technical report explaining all design decisions

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Well-structured code with good documentation covering main components

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Functional code with basic documentation, could be better organized

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poorly organized code with minimal documentation

title: Path Planning for Autonomous Robot
description:
Develop a path planning system for an autonomous robot using search algorithms.

## Objectives
- Implement multiple search algorithms (A*, RRT, PRM)
- Handle dynamic obstacles and replanning
- Optimize for different cost metrics
- Visualize search process and results
- Compare algorithm performance

## Deliverables
- Multi-algorithm path planning system
- Interactive visualization tool
- Performance benchmarks and analysis
- Video demonstrations
- Technical documentation
requirements: Create 2D environment with static and dynamic obstacles
Support different cost functions (distance, time, energy)
Visualize search trees and final paths

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: All three algorithms (A*, RRT, PRM) correctly implemented with optimal performance and robust handling of edge cases

levels.label: Good
levels.description: All algorithms implemented and functional, minor performance or correctness issues

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Two algorithms fully working, third incomplete or has significant issues

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Only one algorithm working or major correctness issues in implementations

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated replanning system that efficiently handles dynamic obstacles in real-time

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Working replanning mechanism that handles most dynamic scenarios effectively

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic replanning implemented but may be slow or handle limited scenarios

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal or non-functional dynamic obstacle handling

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Interactive, polished visualization showing search trees, paths, and real-time algorithm execution

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Effective visualization of key elements with good user interaction

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic visualization present, limited interactivity or polish

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal visualization or poor usability

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive benchmarks across diverse scenarios, detailed analysis of algorithm tradeoffs and cost metrics

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good benchmarking with clear comparison of algorithms in multiple scenarios

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic performance comparison present, limited scenario diversity

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal or incomplete performance analysis

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Clean, modular code with comprehensive technical documentation and video demonstrations

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Well-organized code with good documentation covering main components

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Functional code with basic documentation

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poorly structured code with minimal documentation

title: CSP Solver for Real-World Problems
description:
Build a general-purpose CSP solver and apply it to real-world scheduling problems.

## Objectives
- Implement backtracking with advanced heuristics
- Integrate constraint propagation (AC-3)
- Solve practical scheduling problems
- Visualize search process
- Analyze solution quality and efficiency

## Deliverables
- General CSP solver library
- GUI for problem specification
- Solutions to 3+ real-world problems
- Performance comparison of techniques
- User documentation
requirements: Backtracking with MRV, degree heuristic, LCV
Forward checking and AC-3 constraint propagation
Handle multiple problem types: Course scheduling, Nurse rostering, Exam timetabling, Sudoku puzzles

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Robust generic CSP framework with all heuristics (MRV, degree, LCV) correctly implemented and optimized

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Functional framework with backtracking and main heuristics working correctly

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic backtracking present, some heuristics missing or incomplete

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Framework incomplete or backtracking has major issues

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: AC-3 and forward checking correctly implemented with efficient conflict-directed backjumping

levels.label: Good
levels.description: AC-3 or forward checking working well, backjumping present

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic constraint propagation implemented, may have efficiency issues

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Constraint propagation missing or incorrect

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Successfully solves 4+ diverse real-world problems with high-quality solutions and min-conflicts local search

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Solves 3+ problems effectively with reasonable solution quality

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Solves 2-3 problems, solutions may be suboptimal

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Solves fewer than 2 problems or solutions are poor quality

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Interactive problem builder with excellent visualization of search process and solutions

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Functional GUI for problem specification and good visualization

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic interface present, limited visualization capabilities

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poor or minimal interface and visualization

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive performance comparison of techniques with detailed user documentation

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good performance analysis with clear documentation

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic performance comparison and documentation present

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal analysis or documentation

title: Automated Planning System
description:
Develop an automated planning system for logistics or robotics domains.

## Objectives
- Implement STRIPS/PDDL planning
- Create domain-specific heuristics
- Handle complex planning problems
- Visualize plan execution
- Compare planning approaches

## Deliverables
- Multi-algorithm planning system
- PDDL problem library
- Plan visualization and execution
- Comparative performance analysis
- Technical report on heuristic design
requirements: Implement STRIPS planner with forward search
Create PDDL parser for problem specification
Implement at least 2 domains: Blocks World, Logistics (packages, trucks, locations), or Robot navigation with actions

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Both STRIPS and GraphPlan correctly implemented with optimal performance and robust error handling

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Both algorithms functional with correct plan generation, minor issues present

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: One algorithm fully working, other incomplete or has issues

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Major issues with algorithm implementations or only basic functionality

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated delete-relaxation heuristics with complete PDDL parser supporting complex problem specifications

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Effective heuristics and functional PDDL parser for standard problems

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic heuristics present, PDDL parser handles simple cases

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Weak heuristics or limited PDDL support

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: 3+ diverse domains with partial observability, plan validation, and execution simulation

levels.label: Good
levels.description: 2+ domains well-implemented with validation and simulation

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: 2 domains present, validation or simulation may be limited

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Fewer than 2 domains or poor implementation quality

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive visualization of planning graphs and execution, detailed comparative performance analysis

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good visualization tools with solid performance comparison

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic visualization present, limited performance analysis

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal visualization or analysis

levels.description: Clean, well-architected code with comprehensive PDDL library and detailed technical report

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Well-organized code with good documentation and problem library

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Functional code with basic documentation

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poor code organization or minimal documentation

title: Medical Diagnosis Expert System
description:
Build a knowledge-based expert system for medical diagnosis using logic and probabilistic reasoning.

## Objectives
- Represent medical knowledge using logic
- Implement inference mechanisms
- Integrate probabilistic reasoning
- Create interactive diagnosis interface
- Explain reasoning to users

## Deliverables
- Expert system with knowledge base
- Interactive diagnosis tool
- Inference engine with explanations
- Test cases with known diagnoses
- User manual and technical documentation
requirements: Knowledge base with 20+ diseases and symptoms

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive knowledge base with 25+ diseases, accurate first-order logic representation, well-structured medical knowledge

levels.label: Good
levels.description: 20+ diseases with good logic representation and relationships

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: 15-20 diseases with basic logic representation

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Fewer than 15 diseases or poor knowledge representation

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Both forward and backward chaining correctly implemented with Bayesian network for uncertainty, handles complex reasoning

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Both chaining methods working with probabilistic reasoning

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: One chaining method working well, basic uncertainty handling

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Inference mechanisms incomplete or incorrect

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated Bayesian network with certainty factors, handles missing information elegantly

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Working probabilistic reasoning with uncertainty handling

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic probabilistic features, limited uncertainty handling

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal or incorrect probabilistic reasoning

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Intuitive interface with comprehensive explanation facility showing reasoning steps and confidence levels

levels.label: Good
levels.description: User-friendly interface with good explanations of diagnoses

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Functional interface with basic explanations

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poor interface or minimal explanation capability

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Extensive test cases with validation, comprehensive user manual and technical documentation

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good test coverage with clear documentation

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic test cases and documentation present

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal testing or documentation

title: Robot Localization with Particle Filters
description:
Implement a complete localization system for a mobile robot using probabilistic methods.

## Objectives
- Implement particle filter (Monte Carlo localization)
- Handle sensor noise and motion uncertainty
- Integrate with robot simulator
- Visualize belief distribution
- Compare with other localization methods

## Deliverables
- Robot localization system
- Multiple filtering algorithms
- Interactive simulation environment
- Performance comparison analysis
- Video demonstrations
- Technical report on probabilistic robotics
requirements: Robot simulator with sensors and actuators

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Robust Monte Carlo localization with adaptive resampling, handles kidnapped robot problem effectively

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Working particle filter with correct localization in most scenarios

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic particle filter working, may struggle with difficult scenarios

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Particle filter incomplete or produces poor localization

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Accurate motion and sensor models with noise, all three filters (particle, EKF, histogram) correctly implemented

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good models with 2-3 working filter implementations

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic models, 2 filters working with some issues

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poor models or only one filter working

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Complete robot simulator with realistic sensors, actuators, and obstacle handling

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Functional simulator with good sensor and motion modeling

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic simulator present, limited realism

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Incomplete or overly simplistic simulator

levels.description: Good visualization and solid performance analysis

title: Natural Language Processing with Logic
description:
Build an NLP system that converts natural language to logic and performs reasoning.

## Objectives
- Parse natural language to logical form
- Build knowledge base from text
- Answer questions using inference
- Handle semantic ambiguity
- Explain reasoning process

## Deliverables
- NL to logic converter
- Inference-based QA system
- Test corpus of statements and questions
- Performance evaluation
- User interface
- Technical documentation

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Robust parser handling complex sentences with quantifiers, temporal relations, negation, and compounds

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Parser handles most sentence types with good accuracy

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic parser working for simple sentences, limited complex structure support

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Parser incomplete or handles only very simple sentences

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Accurate conversion to first-order logic, well-organized knowledge base with effective representation

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good logic conversion with functional knowledge base

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic conversion working, knowledge base may have organizational issues

levels.label: Needs Improvement

levels.label: Excellent

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good QA performance using inference, handles most questions

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic QA working for simple questions

title: Multi-Agent Coordination System
description:
Develop a system for coordinating multiple intelligent agents to solve complex tasks.

## Objectives
- Design agent architectures
- Implement coordination protocols
- Handle conflicts and resource allocation
- Optimize collective behavior
- Visualize multi-agent interactions

## Deliverables
- Multi-agent simulation framework
- Coordinated agent behaviors
- Visualization of agent interactions
- Performance analysis
- Comparison of coordination strategies
- Technical report
requirements: Apply to domain: Warehouse automation, Traffic management, Disaster response, or Multi-robot exploration

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated implementation of all three agent types (reactive, deliberative, hybrid) with appropriate architectures

levels.label: Good
levels.description: All agent types implemented and functioning well

levels.label: Satisfactory

levels.label: Needs Improvement
